YOU WERE FOLLOWING TEN FEET BEHIND ME...
TELL ME YOU'RE GONNA GET A MANUAL.
HUNDRED AND SIX FUCKIN' FEET, MISTER
DRIVER'S MANUAL, AND I WANT YOU TO STUDY
THOUSAND PEOPLE WERE KILLED ON THE ROAD
OBEY THE GOD DAMN RULES. FIFTY FUCKIN'
INT THE MADISON HOUSE FRONT DOOR
SIX FUCKIN' CAR LENGTHS... THAT'S ABOUT A
THAT MOTHERFUCKER... AND I WANT YOU TO
IF I'D HAD TO STOP SUDDENLY, YOU WOULD
CAUSE OF FUCKIN' ASSHOLES LIKE YOU.
DO YOU KNOW HOW MANY FUCKIN' CAR LENGTHS
AND YOUR NAME, WHAT THE FUCK IS YOUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a clean moving POV illuminated by headlights.  We' floating down an old two-lane highway through a desolate, desert landscape.  This gliding, eerie POV continues as  credits roll. when the credits end, the headlights seem t dim and soon we're moving through BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the blackness, a man, FRED, is sitting on a bed smokin cigarette. we see his back, but with each glow of the  cigarette ash, we see his face reflected in a mirror on t wall across from him.  In the darkness, there starts the  sound of a motor which draws curtains back across a large picture window just off screen.  As the curtain moves, ha light begins crawling across the room, and we see  everything clearly.  Fred is wearing a robe and pajamas, early morning. CLOSE UP ON FRED'S FACE IN THE MIRROR - Blank expression face somewhat obscured or distorted by smoke from the  cigarette. CLOSE UP 0N FRED'S ACTUAL FACE - Unshaven, haggard look, seem empty, glazed over.  Fred is 32 years old, with dark hair. THE DOORBELL RINGS.  Fred looks up, startled by the noise He looks at the digital clock: 5:30 a.m. FRED STANDS, goes to an INTERCOM on the wall next to the  mirror.  He pushes a button. A VOICE comes over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Laurent is dead. Fred leaves the bedroom and goes through the house.  He i the upstairs level.  He looks through a narrow slot windo but can't see the front door below.  He goes further in t house to a picture window that overlooks the street below There is NOBODY there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see Fred standing at the picture window, looking o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is dressed to go out: Black sport coat and slacks,  buttoned up white shirt.  He picks up a music case.  A wo comes into the room.  This is Fred's wife, RENEE, 30 year old, dark hair, dressed smartly, a drink in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind that I'm not coming tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd stay home and read. Fred looks her over, she's sexy without trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read?... Read what, Renee? Renee sits down on a couch and sips her drink.  Fred come over to her, kisses her on the neck, which makes her laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to know I can still make you laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to laugh, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I married you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake me up when you get home. Fred brushes her cheek with his fingers, allowing them to linger for a moment on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue neon sign reads: LUNA LOUNGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is on the bandstand.  He takes a solo on his saxopho Fred plays hot, hard, neo-bop.  The BAND wails madly behi him.  The PATRONS explode onto the dance floor, making it wild scene.  Fred Is a lion now, roaring away on his teno driving everyone nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the band quits to take a break, FEMALE FANS come on Fred, but he moves away, refusing their attentions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred dials a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. The MADISON HOUSE - NIGHT We move through the empty living room - empty bedroom, et The ringing telephone goes unanswered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOSE UP 0N FPED'S FACE as he listens to the ringing.   Sweat is still rolling off his face.  His eyes are blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred's car pulls up in the driveway in front of his house Fred gets out, and goes into the house carrying his music case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred puts down his music case, goes to the bedroom, and s Renee sleeping soundly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee in a bathrobe, opens the front door to collect the  mail.  She sees a plain, clean, manila envelope lying on step.  She picks it up. CLOSE UP ON THE ENVELOPE - No stamp, no writing, blank. takes the mail from the box, and goes back into the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee opens the manila envelope. She's noticeably nervous when she sees a videotape inside.  She stares at it. Fred enters, also wearing a bathrobe.  He sees Renee star at the videotape - before she hears him enter.  When she hear him, her eyes jerk away from the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A videotape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's it from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... There's no return address  on the envelope... In fact, there's no  address on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it say anything on the tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking it over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing. Fred walks over and picks up the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's see what's on it. Fred takes the tape to the VCR.  He inserts it into the machine, and turns it on.  Fred goes toward the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Renee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. They sit on the couch in front of the television. The TV monitor: We begin on the TV, then the videotape fi the entire frame.  The videotape shows the front of THE  MADISON HOUSE, the camera panning slowly over it.  The  picture is accompanied by an eerie DRONING SOUND.  After camera pans back to the front door, the tape image turns Fred and Renee stare at the snow for a few moments.  Rene looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be from a real estate agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. We see a WIDE SHOT encompassing Fred, Renee, and the snow image on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee is seated at the dining room table - coffee cup and grapefruit in front of her.  She is wearing glasses, read a book.  Fred enters, and sees Renee, who does not look u acknowledge him.  Fred goes into the kitchen, which is ju off the dining room.  He comes back into the dining room a cup of coffee, and sits down with it opposite Renee.  H lights up a cigarette, sips his coffee, and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good book, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?... oh, yeah, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same one you were reading the other night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you didn't come to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, yeah.  No. This is a different one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Called?  When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the club.  You didn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must have fallen asleep.  I was asleep when you got home, wasn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were asleep when I got home, yes. Renee goes back to her book.  Fred sips his coffee and  smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you you could wake me up if you wanted to. Renee looks up at him now, takes off her glasses, and sta at him. CLOSE UP OF FRED'S FACE - a disturbed expression. Renee seems about to say something more, but stops, puts glasses back on and resumes reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is in bed waiting for Renee.  He hears noises from t bathroom - bottles clinking, drawers opening and closing. Renee comes out wearing a robe, which she sheds just befo getting into bed.  Naked under the covers, she switches o her bedside lamp.  The only light in the room comes from outside, through the windows.  Fred moves closer to Renee puts his lips to her cheek, a hand on her breast.  She do not respond.  Fred pulls Renee to him, and kisses her  passionately.  Renee accedes to his demands, but does not participate willingly.  He makes love to her voraciously, her lack of passion disturbs him.  Fred can't stop, howev and when he comes she acts consolingly, stroking him  maternally while he calms down.  He climbs off of her and retreats to his side of the bed. CLOSE UP ON FRED'S EYES - which express his horror and  humiliation. They lie there in the dark silence for a while. Fred turns back toward Renee in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a dream about you last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in the house... calling my name... but I couldn't find you.

dialogues.speaker: FRED'S DREAM
dialogues.text: Fred is walking slowly across the living room. Fred's POV: moving - searching. Fred stops and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively - distant and off screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred?  Fred, where are you? The camera turns slowly back toward the hallway, and as i drifts it RISES UP following along the hall and turning  slowly into the bedroom.  Renee is lying below in the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there you were... lying in bed...  but it wasn't you... It looked like  you... but it wasn't. The camera suddenly dives violently at Renee - into a TIG CLOSE UP.  Her face registers TOTAL FEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is lying in bed with Renee, who is now backlit by he bedside lamp.  Fred looks at her shadowed face, but it's Renee's face.  It's a face Fred has never seen before.  F quickly turns and switches on his bedside lamp, and looks quickly back at Renee, whose face is now her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, are you all right? Fred reaches out a hand and tenderly touches her face.  R covers his hand with her own, and closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee finds another envelope on the doorstep.  She opens pulls out a videotape.  A large dog is BARKING incessantl somewhere in the neighborhood.  Renee looks around to see she can see the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee brings the videotape upstairs with the rest of the  mail.  She is a bit puzzled and unsettled.  She puts the down on a table.  She stares at it.  Fred comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dog woke me.  I lay there for a while, then decided to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell owns that dog? Fred notices the tape and manila envelope on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?  Another tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I just found it on the step. Fred picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want to watch it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. Fred goes to the VCR and inserts the tape.  He turns the  television on.  He is about to start the tape - he looks for Renee.  She's hanging back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do you wanna watch it? Again, Renee seems to be nervous about what could be on t tape, but she hides this from Fred and walks toward the  couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Renee sits on the couch.  Fred starts the VCR and joins h As before, we first see it on the TV, then the videotape  fills the frame.  This tape shows the front of the house, before, then shows the INTERIOR of Fred and Renee's house AT NIGHT. The eerie DRONING SOUND goes throughout. The camera glides at a very high angle near the ceilings  looking down as it travels along a hallway and turns into their bedroom, where we see Fred and Renee sleeping.  The tape image then goes to snow. Fred and Renee stare at the snowy TV picture.  After a fe moments of silence, Renee gets up and switches off the se She is visibly shaken, trembling.  She stares fearfully a Fred who seems less disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee is on the telephone.  Fred is pacing, smoking, behi her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yes, I've been on hold for ten minutes... I can't... All right, thanks. Renee looks around anxiously.  Fred gives her his cigaret which she puffs on.  He lights another and continues paci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, yes... Good... My name is Renee Madison... My husband is Fred Madison, the jazz musician... we        live at 442 Hollis Street... Right... 442 Hollis... near the observatory... Someone's been in the house... at night... while we were sleeping... I know because they sent,  dropped off a videotape... two  videotapes... to show us... That's  right... Yes... it... the second one...  shows us asleep... Someone broke in and  taped us while we slept!... Isn't that  enough?... Okay, sure... We will... 442  Hollis... Yes, we'll be here. Renee hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two detectives are coming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men in suits - the Detectives, ED and AL, are seated the couch, watching the last part of the second videotape The screen goes to snow and stays that way for several  moments, until Fred shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a look at the hallway outside the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four of them go to the hallway, where Ed and Al look  around, especially up toward the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The angle.  The high angle shot on the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd the camera get so high like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And smooth... Almost no movement - back and forth, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you'd get if it was hand held.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right ... This just glided along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detectives enter the bedroom.  Fred and Renee follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the bedroom. The Detectives look around without touching anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you always sleep here?... In this room?... Both of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no other bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... There is, I mean, I use it as a practice room... it's soundproofed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a musician?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I thought my wife ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your axe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tenor... Tenor saxophone.  Do you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tone deaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Renee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you own a video camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Fred hates them. The Detectives both look at Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to remember things my own way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How I remember them.  Not necessarily the way they happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an alarm system?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, actually we do... but we haven't been using it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It kept going off for some reason.  False alarms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be a good time to try using it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody else have a key to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maid?  Relative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, one of us is always here to let the  maid in.  Nobody else has a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Al)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's check the doors and windows... See if there's been a break-in. They all leave the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: INT THE MADISON HOUSE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Ed is checking the door for marks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred's POV: He's watching Ed and Al with Renee who are  outside the house, walking around the property, checking  it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Al are standing by an unmarked police car with Fre and Renee.  The Detectives are about to depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll keep a watch on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As best we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything else happens, you'll call us. Al hands Fred a card.  Ed hands Renee a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what we do. Ed and Al get into the car and drive off.  Renee and Fred look at each other, warily, then go back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is on the bandstand, sweating, and honking his saxophone.  He handles the horn roughly, braying like a b as the CROWD gathered in front of the stage gyrates as on swept away in the madness of the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back, near the side door, Renee can be seen with T MEN, only one of whose faces we see.  The trio are going the side door led by one of the men; we see only the back his head.  Renee glances briefly at the bandstand before exits with the two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP OF        FRED as he plays, seemingly oblivious surroundings. His eyes open and shut as he clamps down on the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back of the club, the side door slowly closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is standing in the living room looking in the direct of the stairwell.  We HEAR someone's steps coming up the  stairs.  It's Renee, who eventually comes into view.  She holding another manila envelope.  She arrives at the top  step. She and Fred lock eyes. Fred takes the envelope, opens it, and pulls out a third  videotape. without saying anything, Fred takes the tape t the VCR.  He inserts it very carefully, slowly.  He hits  play, turns on the television and he and Renee sit down o the couch together and begin to watch with great  apprehension. Again we begin with a WIDE SHOT and then the TV monitor f the screen: We see the interior of the house at night.  T camera glides looking down from a high angle along the  hallway and into the bedroom, where Fred and Renee are  sleeping. Again, the DRONING SOUND plays throughout. in the bedroom where Fred and Renee are seen sleeping,  SUDDENLY, Fred, on the tape, slowly awakens as the camera holds on him.  He rises and turns unnaturally in the bed, if drawn up by his awareness of some strange presence in room.  He comes to a sitting position, his head straining upwards, looking in the direction of the camera.  At this point, the videotape image turns to snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Renee are on the couch.  The TV remains on, show snow. Renee is very upset, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (equally horrified - frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew. Fred reaches over and tentatively takes Renee's hand in h She trembles, allows him to touch her, but otherwise does respond.  Suddenly, she jumps with fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the tape!  There was something else on the tape. Fred gets up and rewinds it, passing an image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  Play it! Fred runs the tape forward. We see snow - then a half-second long MEDIUM SHOT of Fred his knees near the bedroom wall on Renee's side of the be He is looking directly at the camera - his face a ghastly grimace, contorted.  His eyes are WIDE WITH HORROR. Fred runs it back again and FREEZES the tape there on his tormented image.  This image fills the screen.  He and Re stare at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detectives, with Fred and Renee are seated on chairs the couch.  The three videotapes in their manila envelope are stacked on a coffee table in the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember being awakened?  It looks like you were aware of someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't remember anything. it looks like I... but... I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would anyone do something like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone made any threats to either of you recently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or not so recently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not to me. Al, Ed and Fred all look at Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...        no. No. No threats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take the tapes with us, if that's all right with you? Ed looks at Fred, then Renee, both of whom nod their  agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see that the patrol of the house is doubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I want to stay here.  I don't feel safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where would you feel safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. maybe a hotel. Ed and Al are watching this exchange between Fred and Ren with keen interest. There is a strained silence between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you use the alarm system since we were here last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first night ... Not the last two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot.  Anyway, I hate the idea of acting paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acting paranoid?!!! Someone is in our  house while we're sleeping, filming us,  and you don't want to act paranoid?!!! I  thought you set the alarm! Fred gets up, lights a cigarette, paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make sure the alarm is set from now on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that doesn't solve the problem.  Who is doing this?  And why? Ed and Al rise from their chairs.  Ed picks up the envelo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find out, Mrs. Madison. Renee stands with the Detectives.  Fred stands apart - hi expression, pained and bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swinging party is in progress at Andy's house - the man whose face we saw at the Luna Lounge with Renee.  ANDY, 3 years old, a slick guy, is seen moving through the crowd, making small talk, kissing and being kissed.  The PEOPLE are wannabe players, the men mostly shady, gold-chain- wearing, slightly unsavory types; the women dressed  provocatively, big hair and skin-tight dresses.  Through  sliding glass doors we see nude and semi-nude people  cavorting in a swimming pool.  Everyone has a drink in hi her hand.  Renee finishes her drinkt and hands the empty glass to Fred who walks away with it.  Andy grabs Renee, dances with her.  They laugh and talk.  Renee appears to bit intoxicated. Fred, who appears less than thrilled with the carryings o makes his way to the open bar where he orders two drinks. When the drinks arrive he drains one of them completely, sets the empty glass down on the bar.  Then he swallows t other drink, too, and sets down the glass. A MYSTERY MAN, tall, well-dressed and groomed, older than Fred, approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've met before, haven't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.  Where was it that you think we've met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At your house.  Don't you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no I don't.  Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  In fact, I'm there right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  You're where right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At your house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's absurd. The Mystery Man reaches into his coat pocket, takes out a cellular phone and holds it out to Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me. Fred snickers, like this is a bad joke.  The Mystery Man the phone into Fred's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dial your number. Fred hesitates, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Fred shrugs, laughs, dials his number. We HEAR a pick up we stay on FRED'S FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I was here. Fred, still holding the phone, stares at the man standing front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do that? The Mystery Man points to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, mirthful at first, as if it is a party trick of som kind, suddenly turns serious - it's obvious he's thinking of the videotapes.  He speaks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get into my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You invited me.  It's not my habit to go where I'm not wanted. Fred looks at the man in front of him, but speaks again i the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? The man laughs - identical laughs - both over the phone a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me my phone back. The man in front of Fred reaches out his hand for the pho Fred hears the line go dead, and he slowly passes the pho back to the Mystery Man who takes it, folds it, and puts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a pleasure talking to you. The man walks away from Fred.  Renee appears and comes up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were getting me a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute. He takes Renee by the arm and goes over to the host of th party, Andy.  He grabs Andy and points across the room to the Mystery Man, who is engaged in conversation with OTHE GUESTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, who is that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the Mystery Man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know his name.  He's a friend of Dick Laurent's, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Laurent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dick Laurent is dead, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is?  I didn't think you knew Dick. How do you know he's dead? Andy and Renee exchange a worried look, which Fred does n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  I don't know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick can't be dead.  Who told you he was dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, who?... Who's dead? Fred takes Renee by the arm away from Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!  We're leaving now! I didn't want to come here in the first place. Fred drags the reluctant Renee out of Andy's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is driving fast and recklessly.  Renee is drunk and smiling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you meet that asshole, Andy, anyway? Renee stares out the front window - thinks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago... I met him at  this place called Moke's... We... became  friends... He told me about a job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember... Anyway, Andy's  okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got some fucked up friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Renee's car pulls up in front of their house.  F jumps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the car! Fred enters the house, careful to turn off the alarm firs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are only a couple of dim lights on, the house is mo dark.  Fred moves slowly and carefully through his house searching each room for a possible intruder. Fred's POV - moving creepily room by room through the dar house - past the telephone - down the hall to the bedroom There is NO ONE there. He goes back outside for Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee is standing next to the car, shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to stay in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? what is it?  Why did you make me wait out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought there might be somebody inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... of course not. They enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred switches on more lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so odd... Waiting out there, I had  the strangest feeling... Like this had  happened before.  I mean, your telling me  to stay outside while you went in like  that. Fred looks at Renee, then continues to look around the ho disturbed, seriously disquieted.  Renee, still tipsy, fol him, moving from room to room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred and Renee are preparing to go to bed. Renee goes the bathroom off the bedroom. Fred takes another look into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred walks down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred looks around the dark living room.  Then absentminde he begins to inspect objects.  He picks up an ashtray and studies it - lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee is washing her face, standing at the sink in her sl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is staring at himself in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee comes in.  Fred is not there.  She goes to the door peeks down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred?  Fred, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is in the living room now - but a SHADOW moves slo across a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee's POV - down the hallway.  There is just darkness a the end of the hall.  It is EERIE.  After a moment, Fred  slowly walks out of the darkness toward Renee.  He walks of the shot and the camera remains on the rectangle of  darkness at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps can be heard on the stairs.  Fred's head appear the top of the stairway.  He comes up into the living roo carrying a manila envelope, like the ones previously  received.  His expression is strained.  He is alone.  Fre pulls a videotape out of the envelope and inserts it in t VCR, turns it on.  He sits on the couch and watches.  We from a WIDE SHOT to a FULL FRAME SHOT of the video. On the tape is the same nighttime interior of the house,  accompanied by the DRONING SOUND.  The camera moves eeril down the hall toward the bedroom, sliding at a high angle The camera turns slowly into the bedroom - looking down. BLOOD is splattered over the floor, bed, walls.  The came drifts.  THE DEAD BODY OF RENEE lies on the floor at the of the bed.  She is badly mutilated.  Fred is hovering ov her on the tape, ON HIS KNEES, A HORRIFIED, UNBELIEVING  EXPRESSION ON HIS FACE.  On the tape, Fred turns away fro Renee - his hands raised, dripping blood - her blood.  Hi movements are almost mechanical, constricted, as he strai strangely upwards seemingly against his will, as if feeli some enormous pressure.  He looks directly at the camera, face a ghastly grimace, contorted, just before the taped  image goes to snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, sitting in front of the TV, shudders as the tape en He sits trembling, attempts to speak, almost chokes, and  finally releases a tortured, warbly cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee! Fred looks up as if seeing something, he starts to stand, -staggering, partially paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred's POV: A BIG FIST slams into Fred's face, knocking h back in a chair.  Ed and Al are standing in front of Fred

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put, killer! The Detectives' POV: Fred's face is a bloody mask.  He is crying, whimpering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill her! Tell me I didn't kill her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, his lips and eyes swollen, sits on a cot, dressed i jail clothes.  He studies his hands, which appear cripple He flexes the fingers, slowly, painfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in back of the house tracking slowly past the bedr and living room windows. Inside the house, INVESTIGATORS FORENSIC EXPERTS are moving around, measuring, scraping  samples of carpet, searching for fingerprints on furnitur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee's CORPSE on a slab is rolled into an examining room an ATTENDANT.  The entrance of the body is shown reflecte a chrome-framed mirror that juts out from a tile wall.  T Attendant prepares for the impending autopsy, laying out rack of instruments, positioning the corpse.  As he is do these things, the MEDICAL EXAMINER enters, accompanied by GIRLFRIEND.  The M.E. is dressed formally, in a tuxedo. young woman is wearing a slinky dress with a fur wrap,  pearls, spike heels.  The couple are close; she has an ar through his, and she laughs, nervously.  He is smoking a  cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, doc. Workin' late tonight, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party at the mayor's house, George.  This is his daughter, Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, George. The Attendant uncovers the body - individual parts are  wrapped like packages from a butcher's shop, and labeled: ARM, HEAD, R. BREST (misspelled).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the packages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like Christmas. He begins to unwrap them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can watch this. The M.E. tosses his cigarette down on the floor.  The cam goes down on the smoking cigarette butt on the floor drai smoldering there among hair and flesh gristle on the drai filter screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice-over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave any time you want, lover.  I won't take it personally. The camera stays on the drain as we HEAR the M.E. unwrapp the packaged body parts.  Joyce's high heels enter the fr around the drain.  She is stepping nervously, like a spoo horse.  The clatter of her heels is very loud.  We hear t M.E. chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Voice-over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, girl, easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talking to me or... her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A corpse can tell you plenty, Joyce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera is behind a female FOREMAN in the jury box.  T shot begins on her shoes and travels up her body as she stands.  Over her left shoulder we see Fred standing at t defense table. Over her right shoulder the JUDGE is seate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you reached a verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please hand it to the bailiff. The BAILIFF goes to the Foreman, takes the paper from her then takes it to the Judge.  The Judge opens it and reads to himself, then hands it back to the Bailiff, who return to the Foreman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is your verdict? The camera moves to Fred, registering his tension.  The  camera goes to the Foreman's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We the jury find the defendant guilty of murder in the first degree. Fred faints.  Fe is lifted up by his ATTORNEY and GUARDS attendance.  Fred revives slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Madison, the jury having found you  guilty of murder in the first degree, it  is my order that on a date to be  determined, you be put to death in the  electric chair. We see Fred's eyes roll open as he cranes his neck around upwards, looking at the video camera high on the wall of courtroom, pointing down on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARIAN and RAQUEL, two exquisite young women, are looking over the merchandise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that about the guy who  chopped up his wife into a million  pieces?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I miss it?  The TV won't quit with that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna cook him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's from Utah.  He says there you have  a choice... You can die by hanging or by  firing squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which would you choose? Marian holds up a black teddy to her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy would go for this, don't you  think?... Firing squad, definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they aim for the head or for the heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't... The brain would know what's  going on.  Your heart would be ripped  open trying to pump blood, blood pouring  into the chest cavity.  Savage pain,  Marian. Raquel takes a red teddy and holds it up to her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's hot... So you'd rather be hung, huh? They both giggle at the obvious joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely... Soon as your neck snaps,  you black out.  It might take a while for  the body to die, but you wouldn't feel  it. Marian reaches for a pair of panties with a hole in the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be right, Raquel. Marian sticks a finger through the hole in the panties an wiggles it.  The girls giggle.  Raquel sees Andy walking the store.  He is sneaking up behind Marian, and motions a finger to his lips to Raquel not to say anything.  When Andy gets directly behind Marian, he puts his hands over eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, in the custody of GUARDS, wearing handcuffs and leg irons, is being escorted to his cell.  He appears zombie- as the guards open the cell door, unlock and remove his  shackles, and lock him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself to home, fella. The guards leave.  Fred stands near the cell door, begins look around at the four walls, the single cot, the wash  basin, and the toilet bowl without a seat.  He hears the  muffled, DISTORTED NOISES - VOICES from the surrounding  cells.  Lost voices - the voices of death row.  Fred  realizes where he is now.  He walks over to the cot and  slowly sinks down and sits on the edge.  Fred perched on cot in his cell resembles a man adrift on a tiny raft in middle of an ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUSTEE is pushing a meal cart along the row.  At each  door, the Trustee stops and takes a tray off the cart.  H shoves the meal tray through a slot in the door.  We watc him distribute the trays down the long row of cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is quiet - distant sounds reverberate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred sits on the edge of his bed, a tray of prison food s on the floor - uneaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred lies awake on his cot   he stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is quiet - distant sounds reverberate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a small narrow yard, not the large exercise yard population.  This yard is for use by death row prisoners  only, to exercise in one hour each day, by himself.  Fred released into the area, which is more like a dog run.  Th Guards watch Fred as he walks slowly up and down the exer yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is more activity on the row tonight than usual.  A  COUPLE of MEN in suits walk through with an air of author There is a building murmur among the prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred sits on the edge of his bed, listening as sound of  the prisoners builds.  He's shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO GUARDS are standing at the guard station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quietly - solemnly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes. Several of the men in suits, along with several GUARDS, a CLERGYMAN, a PRISONER in the middle of the group, enter t hallway.  They proceed past the guard station down the ha As the procession files by, DEATH ROW INMATES come to the doors and talk to the prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon, Sammy.  Don't think takin'  a jolt is gonna get you outta payin' me  back the twenty you owe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take it personal, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un fuerte abrazo, amigo! As the men march down the hallway, they pass Fred's cell. His window panel is empty.  The camera stops on Fred's ce door, as we HEAR other prisoners talking to the inmate on way to the ELECTRIC CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang in there, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep an eye out for me, Sammy G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred sits on his bed, listening fearfully.  The camera st on Fred as we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show 'em you got big stones, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoner is strapped into the electric chair.  Behind glass partition WITNESSES are seated. One of the men in  suits, the WARDEN, goes to a telephone on the wall and st with his hand on the receiver.  He picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line check. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. The Warden hangs up the telephone and stays next to it. We see one of the condemned man's WRISTS being clamped wi an electrical device.  The other wrist is clamped. A metal halo is placed around the condemned man's head. large electrical cable leads off from the halo. Electrically conductive ointment is smeared around the ar where the clamps have been placed. The Clergyman moves close to the condemned man continuing give the man his last rites.  When he is finished, he nod the Warden.  The Warden approaches the condemned man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any final words, Sam? The condemned man shakes his head "no". The Warden and the others clear the room and the doors ar locked. The EXECUTIONER steps into place near a huge lever.  He l to the Warden. The Witnesses sit in silent anticipation. The hands of the clock on the wall have moved past midnig The Warden takes one last look through a window at the  condemned man - then nods to the Executioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred sits frozen at the edge on his bed. A distant but LOUD ELECTRICAL HUM begins. Fred's head jerks upward to the light on his ceiling.  It dimmed to almost nothing. Fred sits in the humming darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards release Fred into the yard for his exercise. first the sunlight is blinding, and Fred covers his eyes. moves along the wall, tentative, his fingers feeling the Fnally he slumps down on his haunches, back leaned  against the wall, eyes closed, letting the sun hit his fa soon, however, the sun passes behind a cloud and Fred is  bathed in shade.  Fred stands up, but is almost immediate hit by a searing pain in his head.  Fred holds his head w his hands, sinks down to his knees.  The Guard, who has b observing Fred from the doorway, comes over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My... My head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headache, huh?  Too much sun, I guess.   You want to come in?  Still got forty- five minutes outside if you want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  I want to go in. The guard assists Fred back inside the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is on his cot, holding his head.  He is obviously in pain.  He gets up and staggers to the cell door.  Fred pu a CALL button next to the door to summon a guard.  The GU comes and speaks to Fred through a double mesh opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's botbering you, Madison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pain is getting worse.  I need more aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't give you anymore.  I'll talk to the doctor. The guard leaves. Fred collapses to the floor of the cell writhing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is brought in wearing handcuffs and leg irons, a GUA on either arm.  He is placed on a chair in the middle of room.  The guards stand one on each side of him.  A DOCTO enters.  He is in late-middle age, with serious eyebrows. Fred's head is hanging down, chin on chest.  The Doctor l Fred's head and we see dark circles under Fred's eyes; hi face is pale, teeth clenched, eyes tearing.  The Doctor t a light utensil from his pocket, and inspects each of Fre eyes.  He feels Fred's forehead.  After this, he allows  Fred's head to drop down again.  The Doctor takes Fred's  pulse.  He drops Fred's wrist.  He next takes Fred's bloo pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sleeping okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strained whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep. The Doctor goes over to a cabinet, unlocks a drawer, and  removes a large blue pill.  He fills a paper cup with wat from a dispenser, goes back to Fred and places the pill i Fred's mouth.  The Doctor tilts Fred's head up and pours water down his throat, some of it dribbling down the fron Fred's shirt.  The Doctor looks into Fred's mouth to make sure he swallowed the pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll sleep now. (to Guards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him back to his cell. The guards lift Fred by his arms, and shuffle march him o of the infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred awakens on his cot.  He turns and sits up in the  darkness.  A stream of light through the slot window  illumines Fred's head, the forehead of which is swollen a discolored.  He staggers up and shuffles over to the call button, which he leans on.  A few moments later, a GUARD  appears on the other side of the mesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspirin... fly head.  I gotta have more aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor said not to give you anything. You can see him in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my head... The guard looks at Fred through the window, and what he s disturbs him.  The guard makes a strange face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard walks away from Fred's door to the guard statio where another GUARD is sitting at a table, reading a  magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, that wife killer's lookin' pretty fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up from his magazine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one? They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is on the floor lying on back. The camera comes  slowly down at him from the ceiling, like a weight pressi on his head.  Fred's pain is demonstrably overwhelming hi now.  He moans and rolls from side to side in the dimness making grotesque, otherworldly sounds.  As the camera mov into a CLOSE UP, the last image of Fred's head shows the  discolored swelling has increased.  Fred looks up, sensin something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a "For Sale" sign posted in front.  The camera p slowly as in the videotape across the front of the house. The interior of the house is dark, but fleetingly we are  aware of movement, shadows inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marian and Raquel are in the living room, attired in the  undergarments they purchased at the lingerie store.  HOT  MUSIC is BLARING from a stereo.  Marian and Raquel are  dancing, as sexy and wild as it is possible for them to b Andy is lying on his back on the rug, dressed only in  undershorts and socks, the girls stomping feet stepping  furiously around his head and body.  His eyes are closed first, but when he opens them, he sees their feet in a bl He tries to get up, but he is too strung out, and he  collapses again.  Marian and Raquel take him by his hands feet and begin pulling him around the room as they dance. Andy is blitzed, smiling moronically.  The girls' breasts tumble out of their teddies.  Raquel drops her end of And turns up the music even louder, and dances into a frenzy. Marian drops to her knees, Andy's feet on either side of shaking her shoulders and whipping her hair around.  Andy makes another attempt to sit up - he looks at Marian, rea for her but falls back, dead to the world.  Raquel and Ma don't quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is still curled on the floor, but spasms begin to ro his body.  He goes into convulsions, blood gushes from hi nostrils.  His head is badly swollen.  Fred vomits repeat and drags around in his mess.  Fred turns, straining upwa as we've seen him do before.  His face and head are hideo deformed. Fred brings his shaking, tortured hand to his forehead. pulls his hand down across his face squeezing it as it go As his hand passes over his face, Fred's features are rem leaving a blank, white mass with eye sockets. We move into the eye sockets and beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a clean moving POV illuminated by headlights.  We floating down an old two-lane highway through a desolate, desert landscape.  This gliding, eerie POV continues unti headlights illuminate a figure standing at the side of th road.  This figure is a man, PETE DAYTON.  Pete turns,  unsettled, as he looks directly at us as we move closer t him.  The ghost image of a house appears behind Pete.  Th is a girl, SHEILA, standing on the lawn in front of the  house.  She is afraid and is trying to communicate with P Pete doesn't seem to hear her and continues to stare dire at us.  Now Pete seems to move toward us as we move towar him.  His head fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred's blank face begins to contort and take on the  appearance, feature by feature, of Pete Dayton. Fred Madison is becoming Pete Dayton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch the sun rise outside the prison, ascending over strands of barbed-wire above the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD is making his early morning rounds.  He stops at cell and looks in, making a mark with a pencil on a piece paper on a clipboard. when he comes to Fred's cell, he is about to make a check-mark, but looks in again and appear confused.  THE MAN INSIDE IS NOT FRED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?  What are you doing in this cell? The MAN in the cell sits still on the cot, staring straig ahead.  The man is thin, younger than Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard hurries over to the guard station.  He picks up telephone and dials.  He begins to sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Johnny Mack at station 8. Yeah,  look, somethin' crazy's happened.  No, I  mean, Madison ain't in his cell.  No,  there's somebody in there, but it ain't  Madison! Right, right.  Okay... Captain  Henderson's comin''?... Right. Johnny Mack hangs up.  He sweats.  He walks back down the and looks in again at Fred's cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F-u-u-u-ck me! He walks back to the station.  A supervisor arrives, CAPT HENDERSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mack, what's the situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not entirely certain, Captain. You'll have to see for yourself. Together they walk quickly to Fred's cell and look in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not Fred Madison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't say, sir... Captain Henderson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... this is some spooky shit we got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Henderson is standing in front of a desk, behind  which the Warden is seated.  A nameplate on the desk read WARDEN MARSHALL R. CLEMENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat that, Bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warden, it's not him.  It .was not Fred Madison in that cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, it's Madison!!! Who else could it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  The guards say they've never seen him before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the infirmary, being examined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ask him who he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... He can't talk. it appears as if he can't talk, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's not Madison, then where's Madison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got men searching the building and the grounds now. The Warden stands up and comes around the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to take a look at this man myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man from Fred's cell is just finishing being  fingerprinted. The doctor with serious eyebrows - DR. ROGOFF - is inspec the man's face.  The Warden enters with Captain Henderson GUARDS are standing by the door and at strategic spots in room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, Rogoff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet. Dr. Rogoff begins to draw blood from the man's arm. He ta several vials.  The man watches the blood coming out of h arm, but doesn't seem to understand where he is or what i happening to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just been fingerprinted, and I'll  run these blood tests right away.  We'll  find out soon enough. Dr. Rogoff opens the man's mouth and peers in with a penc light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not Madison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly, deliberately

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even close. Dr. Rogoff stands up, puts the light in his breast pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I examined Madison last night, Marshall. He had a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A headache?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did a routine once-over, and gave him a  sleeping pill.  I've never seen this man  before.  Neither have the guards.  I  don't think he's in the system. The Warden moves closer to the man - he looks closely at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell did you come from, mister? CLOSE UP OF THE MAN - he's staring straight up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present are the Warden, Captain Henderson and TWO other  PRISON OFFICIALS.  The Warden is looking at a computer ne to his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, gentlemen, we know who the stranger is. His name is Peter Raymond Dayton. He's twenty-four years old.  His birthday is April 21st.  He was born and raised right here.  He lives with his parents, William and Claire Dayton at 814 Garland Avenue.  Pete Dayton was arrested five

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WARDEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: years ago for auto theft, for which he  was put on probation for one year.  That  was his first and only offense.  No  record since then. Warden Clements looks up, takes a deep breath and stares the men in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Madison?  Have we had even a hint of his whereabouts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Marsh.  Vanished.  There's an  APB out on him.  His photo's been faxed  nationwide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a call from the governor's office about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell does she know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's press outside right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell... 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the guards must have leaked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the word on the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only that Madison has apparently escaped. Nothing about the other guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, let's keep it that way.  Keep a lid on Dayton.  Nothing gets out about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Mack walks down the row and enters Fred's cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Mack looks around, up and down the walls, half pee under the cot, then - checking first to see no other guar watching him - he looks inside the toilet bowl, then gets down on his knees and really looks under the cot.  He get and sits down on the bed.  He rubs a hand over his face. Johnny Mack is clearly perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A press conference is being held.  Present are REPORTERS, cameras, et al.  The Warden and Captain Henderson represe the prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a statement to read... Fred  Madison, an inmate being held on death  row has, apparently... has escaped.  An  all-points bulletin has been issued to  authorities not only statewide, but  nationwide.  We are confindent that he  will be apprehended very soon.  No  further details are available at this  time.  Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warden, nobody's ever escaped from death row before.  How did he get out? The Warden and Captain Henderson leave the room without  answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete's parents, BILL and CLAIRE DAYTON, escorted by a PRI GUARD, are approaching the Warden's office.  It is a long walk along the corridor and the camera examines them in  detail as they get closer and closer to the office.  The  Daytons are a middle-aged, San Fernando Valley couple.  B Dayton is wearing a sport shirt with the short-sleeves ro up. His skin is leathery, tanned and his thinning hair is slicked back in a duck-tail.  He's working-class, ex-bike Claire Dayton was obviously a good looking "chick" who's to seed from too much sun, cigarettes and booze.  She ret the remnants of a good figure, but it's going fast.  Clai is wearing sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Daytons are ushered in by the guard.  The Warden is  standing behind his desk.  Dr. Rogoff is standing to one  side, and next to him is Captain Henderson.  The Daytons  stand just inside the room for a moment before the Warden extends his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Warden Clements.  This is Captain  Henderson and Dr. Rogoff.  Please, sit  down. Bill and Claire move to the chairs in front of the desk a sit down.  The Warden, Dr. Rogoff and Captain Henderson a sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Dayton, as you were told  over the phone, your son, Peter, is here. Claire Dayton removes her sunglasses.  She and Bill wait the warden is searching for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... He was discovered this morning...  in a cell on death row. Bill and Claire look at each other - bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cell that was supposed to be occupied by an inmate named Fred Madison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife killer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is this possible, Warden? The warden shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tell me, what was Peter's condition  the last time you saw him? Bill and Claire look at each other again - briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His condition?  What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His physical condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as always.  Pete takes care of himself. Bill and Claire look at each other once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him before he went to the garage  day before yesterday.  He's a mechanic.  Look, is he okay?  Can we see him? The Warden looks at Dr. Rogoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a hematoma on his forehead and a  condition called blepharitis... that's  redness and swelling around the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he in a fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These conditions don't indicate a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what is the cause then? ... And how did he get in that cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't talk.  Or won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't sound like Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son has experienced some sort of  trauma, I'm afraid.  We were hoping that  the two of you could help explain the  cause of the trauma and how he came to be  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know Fred Madison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Only what was in the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think Pete knows him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you haven't seen your son since the day before yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he went to work, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes he stays at a friend's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any particular friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl's, a buddy's.  I don't know.  He's  his own man; he comes and goes as he  pleases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and we need to talk to him... if we can. (to Dr. Rogoff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel, let's get Peter in here. Dr. Rogoff leaves the room.  While he's gone, nobody talk increasing the tension.  Dr. Rogoff returns with Pete Day dressed in his own clothes: jeans, boots, sport shirt.   Pete's forehead is lumpy and his eyes are red and swollen He can walk, but unsteadily. Pete looks around the room - sees his parents. Claire jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete... She and Dr. Rogoff help get Pete settled in a chair.  Bil taken aback at the sight of his son, but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete, can you tell us now, anything about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete, what happened to you? Pete has a dazed look on his face.  He starts to speak, t stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  Take your time, honey. Pete's gaze drifts from his mother's face around the room back to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afraid - quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where ... am I? The Warden and Captain Henderson look to Dr. Rogoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in the state penitentiary.  You were found in a cell on death row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head hurts. Pete rubs his head like it's about to explode with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man named Fred Madison was occupying  that cell.  He's missing. we're trying  to find out how it is you were in there  and not him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know Fred Madison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There is a silence in the room, as Pete massages his  throbbing temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warden, can we take him home? The Warden looks at Dr. Rogoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Warden)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a medical standpoint, I don't see why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find out what happened here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you made any charges against him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he's coming home with his mother and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... but you see our  predicament... Legally we can't hold  him, but he may be able to help us...  perhaps later.  For now, he's free to  leave. Bill and Claire help Pete up and carefully escort him out the warden's office. With a nod from the Warden, the guar accompanies them out of the room.  The Warden, Captain  Henderson and Dr. Rogoff stand but remain in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to warden)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just gonna let him go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get a tail put on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, Claire and Pete pull into the driveway of a bleache out, 60's ranch-style house on a street lined with many m of the same. Bill and Claire get out of the car first, then help Pete and up into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Claire take Pete to his room, which has a bed, d two chairs and a sea of disassembled motorcycle parts  belonging to a classic Indian motorbike which Pete is  rebuilding.  Each part is shiny and clean. Pete sits down on his bed and looks up at his parents - shaking his head with confusion and embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just rest easy, Pete. You're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry, honey?  I'll fix you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I don't feel so good.  I would  like some aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete sleeps. In the living room, Bill is drinking a beer and watching  television. In the kitchen, Claire is finishing the dishes.  She goes into the living room and leans down and whispers somethin Bill's ear.  Bill nods and Claire walks quietly down the  hallway and opens Pete's door. She looks in on him sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmarked police car pulls up across the street from th Dayton house.  In the front seat are the Detectives, Ed a Al. Al, who is on the passenger side, is holding two  styrofoam cups filled with coffee.  Ed removes from his  inside jacket pocket a 5" x 7" photo of Pete Dayton, whic props up on the dashboard so that it is visible for both  himself and Al.  Al hands one of the cups to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Al. Al studies Pete Dayton's face in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we'll see what this son of a bitch is up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ed and Al sip their coffee and stare at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete Dayton is lying on a chaise lounge.  His forehead is still swollen, but his eyes are less red.  He stares up i the sky - a hot breeze blows over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves slowly through the interior of the empty house cast with shadows.  The refrigerator running is the only sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete slowly moves up to a sitting position, then stands. stretches and walks around the yard feeling the dry,  unwatered lawn on his bare feet. He walks over and leans over the neighbor's fence.  His e fall on a plastic toy boat floating in b child's plastic swimming pool.  He watches the boat as the warm breeze bl it lazily in a circle. A small plane drones overhead. In the distance, a WOMAN finishes hanging out some wash a goes in the back door of her house.  The slamming of her  screen door sounds a thousand miles away. Pete continues to observe these seemingly peaceful  surroundings - but something doesn't feel right to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete is eating a sandwich - he is looking much better. Claire opens a bag of chips and sets them in front of Pet Bill comes in the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the kitchen. Bill comes in and pops a beer - looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Pete?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Here he comes. Their gazes follow a path from the backyard into where Pe has been sitting all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you feelin'? Pete looks at his parents - he can't figure out what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure - brow furrowed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnie called this morning while you were  sleepin'.  They miss you pretty bad down  at the garage.  I told 'im you still had  a "fever".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to know they can't seem to get along without ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't remember the other night, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What night is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night before you showed up in the slammer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I don't.  Why? Bill and Claire just stare at him.  Pete shakes his head takes another bite of his sandwich - but inside the worri feeling returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete is stretched out on his bed watching television.  He hears the front door bell ring - footsteps, and a moment two later the door to his bedroom opens and three of his  friends, CARL, LANIE and STEVE ("V") saunter in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck have you been? Pete pulls himself up to a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just haven't been feelin' well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not contagious are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... You up for a drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?  Hey, Lanie, I heard you were out of it for a while, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found a cyst on my god damn ovary.   Had to cut it out.  You wanna see the  scar? Lanie pulls up her shirt and pulls down her pants a ways revealing a fresh scar about three inches long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hadn't slowed her down none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smacking him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, bone-head. Then Lanie laughs good-naturedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just goin' up'ta "Tops"... Maybe the "Ten Pin".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila'll be at "Tops".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, what's wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Pete hauls himself up off the bed and throws on a black leather jacket. The four of them go through the living room where Bill an Claire are drinking and watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bill and Claire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goin' out with these clowns for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do ya good. After Pete leaves with his friends, Bill and Claire look each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "V" drives a black, beat-up '66 Grand Prix.  Carl and Lan are in the back seat, and Pete rides shotgun.  The four o them., are cruising down Van Nuys Boulevard along with ma other MUSCLE CARS and LOW-RIDERS filled with KIDS looking action. "V's" car is making a hell of a noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate ridin' in this fuckin' car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Pete, "V" loves this rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that goin' my way. "V" has seen a couple. of GIRLS in short, tight dresses  walking up the boulevard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my, oh my.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it in your pants, "V". Some big cars nearby rev their engines.  "V" guns his car it lurches roughly forward.  The sound of the rough runni engine reverberates in Pete's brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This rod is a fuckin, embarrassment, Carl.  Whatiya burn in this thing, "V"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Texaco... What's wrong with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kiddin'... This is the  boulevard... You can't hear yourself  think. Pete shakes his bead with disgust. "V" pulls the car off the boulevard into "Tops" drive-in. Cars are lined up at the "to go" window and all along the side of the building where people are hanging out under a long metal awning.  MUSIC is playing LOUD. "V" pulls into a parking spot by the awning.  The headlig illuminate a group of HIPSTERS - some dancing, some just  hanging out.  THREE or FOUR GIRLS hanging out together tu toward "V's" car.  They see Pete in the front seat, and o of the girls, Sheila, smiles and walks toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  Where have you been? Pete talks to her through the open window while "V", Carl Lanie climb out through "V's" door.  "V" leans back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pete)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm okay. "V" walks off with the others to the "take out" window. Sheila leans in closer to Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sheila's girlfriends saunter over and lean on the car aro her - looking in at Pete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you guys doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we're goin' over to the "Ten Pin".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. "V", Carl and Lanie return with burgers and drinks.  "V's got a mouthful of burger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happenin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're comin' with us.
