dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled and spitting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pile in. Sheila and her girlfriends jump in the car with "V", Carl Lanie and Pete.  "V" fires up the rough-running engine an pulls out - leaving behind a cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bowling alley is divided into a game room area, a bar restaurant area and a bowling area. Pete and the group stroll into the bar and take a large  booth.  MUSIC is playing LOUD. A WAITRESS takes orders for drinks. Bowling pins clatter loudly in the distance. "V" takes one of Sheila's friends and dances with her. Sheila takes Pete by the arm and pulls him up to dance. music is fast, but they dance slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why haven't you called me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I... Sheila looks around and moves closer to Pete.  She whispe urgently, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to you?  What happened to your face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? ... You've been acting strange lately ... Like the other night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember... What happened that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure weren't acting like the Pete Dayton I've always known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatiya mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were acting like a different person. Pete laughs, but Sheila doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else could I be7 Sheila stares seriously at Pete, but then laughs too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Sheila leans in very close to Pete and whispers in his ea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still care about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Sure I do. Sheila pushes her mouth on Pete's and they kiss., Pete br away - looks at Sheila - serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else about that night?... Did anything happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was weird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatiya mean, Sheila?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I really don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Al sit in their unmarked police car watching the  bowling alley entrance and "V's" car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete fires up his souped up Camaro and listens happily to engine purring.  He eases the big Camaro out of the drive and blasts off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete cruises into his parking place and cuts the engine. ARNIE comes rushing toward him, sporting a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We gotta get the stuff and get out of here. Alice starts off across the living room with the pillowca Pete opens his eyes, he sees Alice move as a blur.  He lo around the room, which spins in and out of focus.  His ey land on, a PHOTOGRAPH in a frame on the wall.  This photo troubles him.  Pete squints, then points to the photograp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you?  Are both of them you? CLOSE UP OF THE PHOTOGRAPH - Four people appear in the fr Andy, Renee, Alice and Mr. Eddy. Alice stops and comes back.  She looks at the photo, walk closer to it, and points at herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me. She turns to Pete.  Pete is staring at the photograph - a Alice and Renee in the photograph.  His nose is bleeding profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete?... Pete starts to reel - blood from his nose soaking his shi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up the stairs - down the hall. Pete runs up the stairs        - about to get sicker. Ali him go with a nuance of        disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete staggers toward the bathroom at the rear right of th hallway.  THE HALLWAY SUDDENLY BECOMES HAZY, DIFFERENT AN LONGER THAN IT APPEARED TO BE. Pete wanders down this "changed" hall.  On his left, he  identifies a door with the number 25 on it.  He pauses fo moment in front of it, then goes on until, on his right, comes to a door with the number 26 on it.  He enters thro this door. Inside is a WOMAN in front of a mirror with a MAN.  Her a are resting on a shelf under the mirror as the man takes from behind.  The man's face is blank, featureless, and i buried in the woman's back - we can't see it. Pete now sees that the woman is an extremely whorish vers of Alice - she's looking at Pete's reflection in the mirr He's looking at her reflection in the mirror.  Pete's hea pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pete)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want to talk to me? Pete rubs his head - the pain is severe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want to ask me "why"? Pete staggers out of the room. He closes the door.  The hallway has "changed" back to An hallway.  The doors no longer have numbers. Pete walks, unsteadily, back down the hall - faltering. starts down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete comes downstairs to the living room and sees Alice a the desk in the corner, filling the pillowcase with cash jewelry. She has a PISTOL in her hand. Alice turns when she hears Pete and they study each other face as Pete makes his way to her.  His head is still  throbbing with pain.  His focus goes from her face to the - which is pointing right at him - back to her.  Alice  smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you trust me, Pete?... She laughs and hands him the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick that in your belt. She shows him the pillowcase filled with loot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going through the loot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all this shit... I know a  fence... he'll give us money and get us  passports in exchange for this and the  car... (looks up at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? Alice grabs Pete's arm and hurries him toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice takes Pete to Andy's car and throws him the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You drive. Alice jumps in Andy's car and tosses the bulging pillowca in the back.  Pete takes the revolver out of his belt.  H opens the driver's side door of Andy's car and slowly sit inside.  He sets the pistol on the seat between them.  He looks up at her.  She smiles wildly.  Pete slalms the doo starts the car and they drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Pete pull up into the driveway of a house at th end of a street at the edge of a desert.  Alice gets out a hot wind.  Pete stays in the car as she goes up to the  house. Pete's POV: He watches Alice ring the doorbell.  She wait in front of the door for a few moments, her hair blowing the wind. A HOUSEBOY opens the door.  Alice says something to him - Pete cannot bear anything that is said, even though his  driver's side window is down.  All he can hear is the hot wind blowing. The Houseboy moves out to where he can see Pete, waiting the car.  The Houseboy and Alice exchange information.  T Houseboy points out toward the desert.  Alice turns back the car. The Houseboy watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Pete starts the car and begins backing it out the drive. Houseboy is still standing - watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go to the desert.  He's at his cabin. Pete and Alice drive off.  The Houseboy continues to watc them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the clean moving POV illuminated by headlights.  W floating down an old two-lane highway through a desolate, desert landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete and Alice pull off the two-lane highway onto a barel discernible dirt road that cuts through the dark desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete and Alice drive up to a ONE ROOM CABIN built on stil next to a dry lakebed.  They both get out and go up the  stairs to a porch where Alice knocks on the door.  There no answer. Alice opens the door, but there is NOBODY INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to wait. The hot wind continues to blow. Alice and Pete walk back down to the car. The HEADLIGHTS are on and Alice reaches in through the wi and switches on the RADIO.  She can't get anything in but static, with bits and pieces of old tunes fading in and o She hits the "seek" button.  The radio starts to search. Pete is standing in the glare of the headlights watching Alice walks slowly to him. The camera captures this from a back seat perspective - t drifts toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me, Alice?  Why choose me? The radio sticks on a particular tune - a tune filled wit longing. Alice begins to dance.  She takes Pete's hand an pulls him close to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can be together... You still want to be with me, don't you Pete? Alice gives Pete that wild smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than ever? She kisses Pete over and over.  He begins to kiss her bac She starts to move him in a dance to the music in the gla of the headlights, the hot wind caressing them. The scene is out of a dream.  Alice and Pete help each ot undress as they dance in and out of the light, and the wi whips at their bodies. They sink down on the soft ground and start making love. The lights from the headlights combine with the starlight bathing them in a pristine glow. The music fades and the radio begins to "seek" through st for another station.  The music it finds now is LOUD and  INTENSE. Alice - her hunger appearing, now becomes carnivorous in approach to love making with Pete.  She is the aggressor, highly-charged - she wants more and more - taking, not  giving, insatiable. The headlights flare their bodies in blinding light.  The become amorphous, glowing shapes burning in the light. Pete is trying desperately to please her - to have her. The driving music fills with cracks of piercing static. radio strains to hold the station. Pete's white-hot body clings to Alice.  He chokes with  emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you... I want you... With a burning smile, Alice rolls them out of the beams o light into the darkness.  The wind billows a black cloud dust around them. Alice pulls away from Pete and brings her dark mouth to h ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never have me. Alice glides away from Pete and stands up looking down at from above. She turns and walks, naked, to the cabin where she disapp within it. Pete turns, face down on the ground in the darkness.  He' holding his head and shaking. As he starts to stand - he turns into the glare of the headlights and we see that it is NOT PETE - BUT FRED. As Fred stands up, the car's LIGHTS DIM and the RADIO FAD Fred looks at the car.  He sees some movement inside.  Fr looks closer and sees the figure of a man in the back sea CLOSE UP OF THE MAN - it's the Mystery Man from Andy's pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Fred turns toward the cabin and sees the Mystery Man now  standing in the doorway. Fred turns again to the car, but this time it's empty.  H looks back at the cabin and sees the Mystery Man still in doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am. Fred is dizzy with fear and confusion. He pulls on his trousers and shoes and walks up the steps the cabin toward the Mystery Man, who goes inside.  Fred  stops in the doorway.  He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Alice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice who? Fred looks around again but there is no one there except Mystery Man - standing in the center of the room.  Fred  stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name is Renee.  If she's told you her name is Alice, she's lying. (filled now with anger)

dialogues.speaker: NAME
dialogues.text: Fred freaks, scared to death. He bolts down the stairs to the car, stumbling more than once.  Fred attempts to start the car which is drained of electr charge by the use of the headlights and radio. The Mystery Man appears in the doorway of the cabin.  He  starts toward Fred. The starter motor moans as Fred twists the key franticall The smiling Mystery Man is almost at the car, The engine catches.  Fred revs it - throws the car in rev and peels out away from the Mystery Man, whose hand is reaching for him. Fred swerves the car around - throws it in drive, and tak off across the dark desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred pulls up onto the two-lane highway.  An old, rusted  roadsign is posted there.  It reads: "LOST HIGHWAY".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is driving along the two-lane desert "lost highway". The wind is picking up even stronger than before.  A big  storm is blowing in. Fred sees a sign glowing just ahead that reads: LOST HIGH HOTEL.  The sign is swaying and blinking as the gusts hit Fred pulls in and stops under the sign and stares at it. He gets out of the car, tucks the pistol in his belt unde his shirt and enters the hotel, which is an old two-story building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred walks up to the registration desk, where a CLERK is  smiling at him in a half-baked way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got in before the big storm hits. Fred pulls the roll of bills from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is strangely similar to Pete's vision upstair Andy's.  Fred comes to the door numbered 25, looks at his which says "25" and unlocks the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred takes the revolver out of his shirt and puts it unde the pillow on the bed. He sits on the edge of the bed.  He takes a cigarette fro pack in his shirt pocket and lights it with a match from book of "Lost Highway Hotel" matches. Fred smokes the cigarette, listening to the wind blow.   Lightning cracks outside the window. Fred crushes the cigarette out in the ashtray on the beds table.  As the last of the blue smoke drifts away, Fred f back on the bed. Fred closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera moves in on the door numbered 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee is in bed with Mr. Eddy/Laurent.  He and Renee are  feverishly making love as the storm rages outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A criminal investigation is under way.  Ed and Al are  present, among a fleet of LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL who a busy dusting for fingerprints and examining the murder si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Al, look at this. Al walks over to where Ed is looking at the photo on the  wall.  Al looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her, all right.  Fred Madison's  wife ... with Dick Laurent and Mr. Dent- head over there. CLOSE UP ON THE PHOTOGRAPH - that shows RENEE AS THE ONLY WOMAN IN THE PICTURE, standing between Andy and Mr. Eddy/ Laurent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got Pete Dayton's prints all over this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as a bad coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee is sitting half dressed on the edge of the bed, pul on her stockings.  Mr. Eddy/Laurent is asleep next to her Renee stands up, finishes dressing, then leans down and  kisses her lover while he sleeps.  Renee leaves the room, closing the door as quietly as possible behind her. As the door CLICKS, Mr. Eddy/Laurent wakes up.  He sits u and gets a pack of cigarettes from the bedside table, sha one out, lights it with a book of "Lost Highway Hotel"  matches, and smokes it while seated on the edge of the be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, still fully dressed, is waking up, AS IF IN A TRANC the same attitude he had on the videotape.  He strains  upwards and looks eerily around the room.  He gets up and crosses slowly to a window.  He takes the edge of the win curtain and pulls it back. The view is of the gravel parking lot of the hotel. Fred's POV: He sees Renee, down below, walk over to a car get in and drive away. Fred walks back to his bed, picks up his revolver from un the pillow, crosses the room to the door and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred crosses over to Room 26 and knocks softly on the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Eddy/Laurent is standing - almost dressed, when he he the knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee? He goes to the door and opens it a crack. As the door opens, Fred smashes the gun into Mr. Eddy/  Laurent's face and pushes his way inside the room. Fred hits Mr. Eddy/Laurent viciously again with the gun  barrel. Mr. Eddy/Laurent is bleeding profusely from gashes on his forehead and nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing the gun at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming with me. Fred puts the pistol up against Mr. Eddy/Laurent's head a marches him out of the room - past the camera's eye. The camera stays in the room and moves slowly toward the  window, through which we see Fred and Mr. Eddy/Laurent ap down below in the back lot. Still watching out the window, the camera sees Fred knock Eddy/Laurent over the head with the gun butt and put him the trunk of a car.  Fred slams the trunk lid and climbs the driver's side of what is obviously Mr. Eddy/Laurent's - the Mercedes 600 Pullman. As Fred drives away, a HAND appears in our window foregro The hand moves the window curtain further to one side.  T camera pulls back to reveal it as the hand of the Mystery Man.  The Mystery Man leans fully into the frame and watc Fred drive off down the Lost Highway as day breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is driving along the road.  Suddenly he pulls the ca off the road and drives over the dirt and brush to a dese spot, stops and gets out. Fred opens the trunk. When he does ... Suddenly, Mr. Eddy/Laurent charges up and attacks Fred - knocking them both to the ground.  Mr. Eddy/Laurent tries strangle Fred, but Fred's anger is too great.  Fred tears loose and gets Mr. Eddy/Laurent in a hold bending his hea back.  Fred's hand reaches out behind him - feeling,  searching. A KNIFE appears. it comes into Fred's hand from another. Fred slices Mr. Eddy/Laurent's throat, and throws him dow Mr. Eddy/Laurent squirms on the ground - his hand grasped around his throat - trying to hold his neck together.  Bl is flowing rapidly through his fingers and over the front him as be turns and opens his mouth with a gurgling sound Fred stands, facing him, his pistol out now - pointing ri at Mr. Eddy/Laurent's forehead. CLOSE UP ON MR. EDDY/LAURENT - he lifts his head and star at Fred.  Blood is rushing out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wet and jagged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you guys want? The camera pans around to Fred - we see that the Mystery is standing beside Fred, and it is the Mystery Man who is holding the gun, not Fred. The Mystery Man reaches into his pocket and pulls out a  little watchman TV.  He turns it on and hands it over to Eddy/Laurent, who manages to take it. Mr. Eddy/Laurent looks down at the small television scree Mr. Eddy/Laurent's POV: As he watches the TV screen, we m in until the screen fills the frame - as with the former  videotapes.  The full frame of the TV screen reveals -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the movie screen on a wall in Andy's living room. Marian, Raquel and RENEE'S images are being projected on screen, simultaneously involved in pornographic acts with men. Watching this movie in Andy's living room are severa people in shadows behind the light of the projector.  Amo them we see RENEE and MR. EDDY/LAURENT standing next to A Mr. Eddy/Laurent and Renee are hot - kissing - his hand i under her skirt.  They are watching the porno film.  They watching murky images of sex turning to violence. In a CLOSE UP we see Renee and Mr. Eddy/Laurent in the  shadows looking out at the film, both half-smiling, stone aroused. The image on the Watchman changes now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Watchman TV screen Mr. Eddy/Laurent sees an image Fred and the Mystery Man staring at him.  The Mystery Man image speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you can hand it back to me. Mr. Eddy/Laurent sees the Mystery Man's image reach out a hand. Mr. Eddy/Laurent looks up.  The Mystery Man has his arm  outstretched just as it was on the video image.  Mr. Eddy Laurent hands the Watchman back, and locks eyes with the  Mystery Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wet and jagged)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me, mister, we can really out- ugly the sumbitches, can't we? The mystery Man unloads the pistol into Mr. Eddy/Laurent, jerks and dies in the dust. The Mystery Man then leans close to Fred and whispers in ear. The camera moves in, past the Mystery Man to a CLOSE UP O FRED'S EYES as he listens. The camera cuts back wide to reveal Fred holding the gun. is standing alone - there is no Mystery Man.  Fred turns go back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred drives up to his house in Mr. Eddy/Laurent's Mercede 600 Pullman and stops in front.  He gets out of the car, to the front door and RINGS THE DOORBELL.  There is a BEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dick Laurent is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fred finishes this sentence we see the cop car contain Ed and Al pull in to the curb just up the street from Fre and Renee's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred turns and sees the cop car.  He jumps in his car, fi it up, and peels out.  The cops give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is behind the wheel of his car.  Behind him are the  cops. CLOSE UP ON FRED'S FACE - through the front windshield. shot is wide enough to reveal the cop car in hot pursuit. Fred's face begins to change again, grotesquely contortin he races into the vortex.  His tormented SCREAM blends wi the howling SIREN of the police car gaining on him.
